arma

Class Arma

  • java.lang.Object
    • arma.Arma

  • public class Arma
extends java.lang.Object
    Arma includes stand-alone interfaces similar to the Armadillo C++ Algebra Library by Conrad Sanderson et al., based on DenseMatrix64F from Peter Abeles’ Efficient Java Matrix Library (EJML) Version 0.23 - 21.06.2013.
    Version:
    0.9
    Author:
    Sebastian Niemann
    See Also:
    Armadillo C++ Algebra Library, Efficient Java Matrix Library

    • Method Detail

      • det

        public static double det(Mat matrix)
        Returns the determinant of the provided matrix. Fails if the matrix is not square.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The provided matrix.
        Returns:
        The determinant.

      • abs

        public static Mat abs(Mat matrix)
        Creates a new matrix with the absolute value for all elements of the provides matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The provided matrix.
        Returns:
        The created matrix.

      • qr

        public static void qr(Mat Q,
      Mat R,
      Mat X)
        Performs a QR decomposition of the provided matrix X into the product QR.
        Parameters:
        Q - An orthogonal matrix.
        R - An upper triangular matrix.
        X - The matrix to be decomposed.

      • floor

        Creates a new matrix with all elements of the provides matrix element-wise floored.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The provided matrix.
        Returns:
        The created matrix.

      • find

        public static Mat find(Mat a,
       Op operation,
       double b)
                throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Creates a new matrix with its values set to 1 for each element where a operation b holds and 0 otherwise. The single provided right-hand side value is used for all operations. Only relational operators are supported.
        Parameters:
        a - The left-hand side operand.
        operation - The operation to be performed.
        b - The right-hand side operand.
        Returns:
        The created matrix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Thrown if another operation besides relational operators is requested.

      • find

        public static Mat find(double a,
       Op operation,
       Mat b)
                throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Creates a new matrix with its values set to 1 for each element where a operation b holds and 0 otherwise. The single provided left-hand side value is used for all operations. Only relational operators are supported.
        Parameters:
        a - The left-hand side operand.
        operation - The operation to be performed.
        b - The right-hand side operand.
        Returns:
        The created matrix.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Thrown if another operation besides relational operators is requested.

      • any

        public static boolean any(Mat matrix)
        Returns true is any element of the provided matrix is non-zero and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The provided matrix.
        Returns:
        The truth value.

      • norm

        public static double norm(Mat matrix,
          int p)
        Returns the (induced) p-norm of the provided matrix. If matrix is actually a vector, p must be an integer greater than 0. Otherwise, p must be one of 1, 2.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The provided matrix.
        p - The type of the norm.
        Returns:
        The norm.
